name: Quill AI
headline: AI Powered Equity Research Platform
description: Quill AI automates the tedious parts of researching and investing in public equities. Extract back-linked data from SEC filings and earnings calls, get excel-downloadable financial historicals with company-specific KPIs, and digest earnings results faster every quarter. Faster processes help you increase your coverage per analyst.

founders.name: Gabriel Banks, Founder
founders.description: Love to touch computer all day

founders.name: Kartik Donepudi, Founder
founders.description: Quill AI, Computer Science and Economics at MIT

markdown:
raw_markdown="[![quill logo](https://quillai.com/quill.svg) Quill](https://quillai.com/</>)
Products
[SEC Viewer](https://quillai.com/</#features>) [Excel Extension](https://quillai.com/</excel>) [Earnings Calls](https://quillai.com/</earnings>)
[Pricing](https://quillai.com/</#pricing>) [Features](https://quillai.com/</#features>) [Press](https://quillai.com/</#press>)
[Sign In](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com>)
Quill AI
A delightful way to 
[Get started](https://quillai.com/<#pricing>)
USED BY ANALYSTS AT
![](https://quillai.com/mslogo.svg) ![](https://quillai.com/gslogo.svg) ![](https://quillai.com/tglogo.svg)
FEATURED ON
![](https://quillai.com/bloomberglogo.svg)
EXCEL EXTENSION
Update any model in one click
Quill’s Excel Addin pulls numbers straight from the earnings release into your Excel model the moment it’s available. Updates work on _your model, as is_.
With Quill, there’s no copy-paste, no formatting, and no templates required. Just plug it in, and watch as your existing models fill with accurate, timely data—every single quarter. Stay focused on making smart trades, not on cleaning up spreadsheets.
Contextualize any model
Quill’s Excel Addin highlights your model and identifies any outliers. Then, it pulls context from the relevant filings to explain the figures.
WEB APP
Extract key information from filings _just by asking_
Leverage Quill's financially-tuned AI to quickly answer questions about any company’s public investor materials. Each response includes state-of-the-art sentence-level source citations that take you back to the relevant filings. This also prevents the AI from hallucinating information. Unlike ChatGPT, which has a training cutoff date, Quill always has up-to-date financial data.
Try it out
Chat
Ask about companies and their 10K/10Q/8K filings. You can also extract numerical data into spreadsheets.
Tell me about TSLA's new factories.What was Amazon's AWS spend, revenue, and margin % for the last 4 quarters?What are some differences between the way that AMD and Intel manufacture their chips? To what extent does each manufacture in house, vs outsourcing, and to whom do they outsource?
No chats. Use the chat box at the bottom. 
Historical financials for a fraction of the cost
Quill has complete tabular historical financial data, collected and organized by our in-house models. Each number comes with a link to its location in the original filing, making the data easily verifiable. All data is Excel-downloadable, so you’ll never manually fill in historicals again. Access real-time SEC Filings, earnings call transcripts, insider transactions, and investor presentations. As soon as filings are uploaded to the SEC, they are available on Quill. Files are highlightable in our in-house document viewer, and highlights are shareable for easy collaboration with team members. Whenever a company you’re tracking releases a filing, Quill Alerts will email you with a customizable analysis of the filing. Quill can also send you an updated version of your metrics spreadsheet the minute the information is released on the SEC.
See $AAPL Historicals (desktop recommended)
Earnings call metrics/guidance
Quill provides any of the company's results and guidance, along with sources for those claims, _and_ management's commentary for the results/guidance. This is automatable and exportable to Excel.
$NVDA reported metrics (last quarter):
Metric| Value| Key drivers  
---|---|---  
Q1 Revenue| [Revenue of $26 billion was up 18% sequentially and up 262% year-on-year and well above our outlook of $24 billion.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=2352&end=2465>)| [Strong demand for NVIDIA Hopper GPU computing platform.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=2591&end=2669>)  
Q1 Data Center Revenue| [Data Center revenue of $22.6 billion was a record, up 23% sequentially and up 427% year-on-year.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=2494&end=2589>)| [Strong demand for NVIDIA Hopper GPU computing platform.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=2591&end=2669>)  
Q1 Compute Revenue from Data Center| [Compute revenue grew more than 5x and networking revenue more than 3x from last year.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=2671&end=2755>)| [Strong growth driven by all customer types.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=2757&end=2877>)  
Q1 Networking Revenue from Data Center| [Compute revenue grew more than 5x and networking revenue more than 3x from last year.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=2671&end=2755>)| [Strong growth driven by all customer types.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=2757&end=2877>)  
Q1 Automotive Revenue| [Automotive Revenue was $329 million, up 17% sequentially and up 11% year-on-year.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=15034&end=19856>)| [Growth driven by ramp of AI cockpit solutions and self-driving platforms.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=15722&end=15855>)  
Q1 Gaming Revenue| [Gaming revenue of $2.65 billion was down 8% sequentially and up 18% year-on-year.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=13347&end=13427>)| [Seasonal decline and year-on-year growth.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=13429&end=13479>)  
Q1 Pro Visualization Revenue| [Revenue of $427 million was down 8% sequentially and up 45% year-on-year.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=14561&end=14633>)| No reason found  
Q1 Gross Margin (GAAP)| [GAAP gross margin expanded sequentially to 78.4%.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=16413&end=16461>)| [Lower inventory targets.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=16498&end=16524>)  
Q1 Gross Margin (non-GAAP)| [non-GAAP gross margins to 78.9% on lower inventory targets.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=16466&end=16524>)| [Lower inventory targets.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=16498&end=16524>)  
Q1 GAAP Operating Expenses| [Sequentially, GAAP operating expenses were up 10%.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=16606&end=16655>)| [Higher compensation-related costs and increased investments.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=16701&end=16808>)  
Q1 Non-GAAP Operating Expenses| [non-GAAP operating expenses were up 13%, primarily reflecting higher compensation-related costs and increased compute and infrastructure investments.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=16660&end=16808>)| [Higher compensation-related costs and increased investments.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=16701&end=16808>)  
Q1 Shareholder Returns| [In Q1, we returned $7.8 billion to shareholders in the form of share repurchases and cash dividends.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=16810&end=16909>)| No reason found  
Q1 Dividend Increase| [We are also increasing our dividend by 150%.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=17032&end=17075>)| No reason found  
Q2 Revenue Guidance| [Total revenue is expected to be $28 billion, plus or minus 2%.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=17128&end=17189>)| [Growth on all market platforms.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=17191&end=17242>)  
Q2 GAAP Gross Margin Guidance| [GAAP and non-GAAP gross margins are expected to be 74.8% and 75.5%, respectively, plus or minus 50 basis points, consistent with our discussion last quarter.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=17244&end=17400>)| No reason found  
Q2 Non-GAAP Gross Margin Guidance| [GAAP and non-GAAP gross margins are expected to be 74.8% and 75.5%, respectively, plus or minus 50 basis points, consistent with our discussion last quarter.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=17244&end=17400>)| No reason found  
Q2 GAAP Operating Expenses Guidance| [GAAP and non-GAAP operating expenses are expected to be approximately $4 billion and $2.8 billion, respectively. Full year OpEx is expected to grow in the low 40% range.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=17481&end=17649>)| No reason found  
Q2 Non-GAAP Operating Expenses Guidance| [GAAP and non-GAAP operating expenses are expected to be approximately $4 billion and $2.8 billion, respectively. Full year OpEx is expected to grow in the low 40% range.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=17481&end=17649>)| No reason found  
Q2 Tax Rate Guidance| [GAAP and non-GAAP tax rates are expected to be 17%, plus or minus 1%, excluding any discrete items.](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/transcript/NVDA/2025/1?start=17840&end=17938>)| No reason found  
Earnings call Q&A Analysis
Achieve a fast and accurate understanding of Wall Street analysts’ main concerns with regards to any public company with Quill’s earnings call Q&A sentiment analysis.
$NVDA earnings call Q&A breakdown (last 4 quarters):
PRICING
WEB ONLY
$39/month
Get full access to the Quill Web platform. SEC filings, earnings transcripts, alerts, custom data extraction, PDF to spreadsheet, and more. 7-day full refund guarantee.
[Buy - 7 day refund](https://quillai.com/<https:/buy.stripe.com/3csdT0bhbfYxb7i7sB?client_reference_id=0>)
EXCEL & WEB
Contact us
Schedule a 30-minute demo to see how Quill's Enterprise Suite can benefit your firm. API, dataroom, Excel extension, custom workflow automation, and more.
[Contact](https://quillai.com/<https:/app.quillai.com/other/buy/enterprise?ref=0>)

generated_description:
**Quill AI: Rethinking Equity Research with AI**

Founded in 2023, Quill AI has quickly captured attention in the world of fintech and equity research. Nestled in New York and a participant in Y Combinator’s S23 batch, they are a compact team of three, spearheaded by Jared Friedman as their group partner. Their mission? To transform how analysts interact with public equity data.

At its core, Quill AI is about automation and efficiency. Where traditional equity research can be a tedious slog through SEC filings and earnings calls, Quill AI offers an intelligent solution that not only extracts relevant data but also cleans and organizes it for quick analysis. This means that analysts can focus on making informed decisions rather than getting bogged down in spreadsheet gymnastics.

Quill AI’s web application allows users to pose specific questions about companies and their financials—think of it like having a financial research assistant that doesn’t need coffee breaks. Want to know Tesla's latest factory updates or Amazon's quarterly revenue? Just ask. The AI is designed to pull precise information, complete with source citations, ensuring that what you get is not just timely, but also accurate.

Their Excel extension adds even more power: it updates your models automatically with fresh data from earnings releases, eradicating the drudgery of manual updates. This kind of integration boosts an analyst’s productivity, allowing them to cover more ground with the same time investment.

Quill AI has also developed robust features like historical financial data retrieval, real-time alerts for SEC filings, and extensive context for earnings call metrics. Analysts at major firms like Morgan Stanley and Goldman Sachs are already using Quill to sharpen their insights and improve their reporting.

Pricing for Quill AI is straightforward—$39 per month for web-only access, with a demo available for those interested in their enterprise solutions that include API access and workflow automation.

In a landscape cluttered with data, Quill AI is carving out a niche by making messy financial information accessible and useful. They are at the forefront of the AI-driven finance revolution, making investing smarter and more efficient, one spreadsheet at a time. For more information, check out their website: [quillai.com](https://quillai.com).
